tool.name: bigwigCompare
tool.description: compares two bigwig files based on the number of mapped reads

param.name: comparison_type
param.label: How to compare the two files
param.help: The reciprocal ratio returns the negative of the inverse of the ratio if the ratio is less than 0. The resulting values are interpreted as negative fold changes.

param.name: binSize
param.label: Bin size in bp
param.help: Size of the bins in bp for the ouput of the bigwig/bedgraph file

param.name: region
param.label: Region of the genome to limit the operation to
param.help: This is useful when testing parameters to reduce the computing time. The format is chr:start:end, for example "chr10" or "chr10:456700:891000"

param.name: missingDataAsZero
param.label: Treat missing data as zero
param.help: This parameter determines if missing data should be replaced with a zero. If set to "no", missing data will be ignored and will not be included in the output file at all. Missing data is defined as those regions for which no value exists in *any* of the bigwig files. The decision to include or exclude missing data depends on the interpretation of the data. Missing data in a bigwig file may mean that there is no information available for certain regions, for example a repetitive region that is not being considered. In the same file regions with low coverage may get zero read counts. If missing data is replaced by zero, this would convert the excluded repetitive regions into regions of low coverage.

param.name: pseudocount
param.label: Pseudocount
param.help: Small number to avoid dividing by zero.

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool compares two bigwig files based on the number of mapped reads. To compare the bigwig files the genome is partitioned into bins of equal size, then the number of reads found in each BAM file are counted for such bins and finally a summarizing value is reported. This vaule can be the ratio of the number of readsper bin, the log2 of the ratio, the sum or the difference.
